briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study With Empagliflozin (BI 10773) vs. Placebo as add-on to Metformin or Metformin Plus Sulfonylurea Over 24 Weeks in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
officialTitle: A Phase III Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group, Efficacy and Safety Study of BI 10773 (10 mg, 25 mg) Administered Orally, Once Daily Over 24 Weeks in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus With Insufficient Glycaemic Control Despite Treatment With Metformin Alone or Metformin in Combination With a Sulfonylurea

interventions.name: Placebo identical to BI 10773 high dose
Placebo identical to BI 10773 low dose
Placebo identical to BI 10773 low dose
Placebo identical to BI 10773 high dose

summary: The objective of the current study is to investigate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of two doses of BI 10773 compared to placebo given for 24 weeks as add-on therapy to metformin or metformin plus sulfonylurea in patients with Typ 2 Diabetes Mellitus with insufficient glycaemic control.
